Class MockBundleContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.steria.osgi.mocks.MockBundleContextBase
      • no.steria.osgi.mocks.MockBundleContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.osgi.framework.BundleContext, org.osgi.framework.BundleReference

    public class MockBundleContext
extends MockBundleContextBase
    Mock implementation of BundleContext.
    Author:
    Steinar Bang

      • MockBundleContext

        public MockBundleContext(MockBundle bundle)
        Constructor used when it is necessary to create the bundle in the test, e.g. when providing a BundleWiring object.
        Parameters:
        bundle - a mock Bundle object.

      • MockBundleContext

        public MockBundleContext()
        The typical constructor to use in a simple test. Will create a MockBundle without a BundleWiring object.

      • registerService

        public org.osgi.framework.ServiceRegistration<?> registerService(String clazz,
                                                        Object service,
                                                        Dictionary<String,?> properties)
        Register a service with the bundle context.
        Specified by:
        registerService in interface org.osgi.framework.BundleContext
        Overrides:
        registerService in class MockBundleContextBase
        Parameters:
        clazz - the fully qualified name of the interface of the service being registered
        service - the object referencing the service
        properties - a name/value map for names and values that can be used to qualify the service when multiple implementations are availabl
        Returns:
        a ServiceRegistration object that can be used to unregister the service later

      • getServiceReferences

        public org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference<?>[] getServiceReferences(String clazz,
                                                            String filter)
                                                              throws org.osgi.framework.InvalidSyntaxException
        Get all ServiceReference object matching a class name and a filter.

        Note: neither the clazz nor the filter argument is handled in any way If this is needed to make tests run as expected it must be implemented For now, just return all of the references in the mock.

        Specified by:
        getServiceReferences in interface org.osgi.framework.BundleContext
        Overrides:
        getServiceReferences in class MockBundleContextBase
        Parameters:
        a - fully qualified class name
        a - filter expression matching a service and its parameters
        Returns:
        an array of ServiceReference objects implementing the matching service, or an empty array if none can be found
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.InvalidSyntaxException

      • ungetService

        public boolean ungetService(org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference<?> reference)
        Tell the service registration that a particular service is no longer being used.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • unregisterService

        public boolean unregisterService(MockServiceRegistration<?> unregisteredServiceRegistration)
        Retract a service registration (a provided service).
        Parameters:
        unregisteredServiceRegistration - a ServiceRegistration for the service that should be unregistered
        Returns:
        true if unregistration is successful and false if unregistration fails (e.g. if the service can't be found).
